sen.j: 長享・延徳の乱（ちょうきょう・えんとくのらん）とは、室町時代後期の長享元年（1487年）と延徳3年（1491年）の2度に亘って室町幕府が行った近江国守護・六角高頼に対する親征で、六角征伐とも言われる。
sen.e: Chokyo-Entoku Wars were campaigns conducted by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) two times in 1487 (1st year of Chokyo era) and in 1491 (3rd year of Entoku era) in the late Muromachi period against Omi no kuni shugo (the provincial constable of Omi Province) Takayori ROKKAKU and it was also referred to as Rokkaku Seibatsu (suppression).

The Chokyo-Entoku Wars were campaigns conducted by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) twice in 1487 and in 1491 in the late Muromachi period against Omi no kuni shugo (the provincial constable of Omi Province) Takayori ROKKAKU, and it is also referred to as Rokkaku Seibatsu (suppression).
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。 two times→twice,was→is と修正しました。(1st year of Chokyo era), (3rd year of Entoku era)はそれぞれ必要ないと判断し、削除しました。
sen.e: The Chokyo-Entoku Wars were campaigns conducted by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) twice in 1487 and in 1491 in the late Muromachi period against Omi no kuni shugo (the provincial constable of Omi Province) Takayori ROKKAKU, and it is also referred to as Rokkaku Seibatsu (suppression).

sen.j: なお、1回目については近江国栗太郡鈎（まがり）（滋賀県栗東市）に陣が布かれたことから、鈎の陣とも。
sen.e: In addition, the first campaign was also called Magari no Jin because a position was taken up in Magari, Kurita gun, Omi Province (Ritto City, Shiga Prefecture).
In addition, the first campaign was also called Magari no Jin because a position was taken up in Magari, Kurita County, Omi Province (Ritto City, Shiga Prefecture).
In addition, the first campaign was also called Magari no Jin because a position was taken up in Magari, Kurita County, Omi Province (Ritto City, Shiga Prefecture).

sen.j: 応仁・文明の乱が収束したのち、各地では守護や国人らが寺社領などを押領して勢力を拡大していた。
sen.e: After Onin-Bunmei Wars came to an end, Shugo (provincial constables) and Kokujin (local lords) have extended their power in various places by wresting territories of temples and shrines and so on.
After Onin-Bunmei Wars came to an end, Shugo (provincial constables) and Kokujin (local lords) have extended their power in various places by wresting territories of temples and shrines and so on.
After Onin-Bunmei Wars came to an end, Shugo (provincial constables) and Kokujin (local lords) have extended their power in various places by wresting territories of temples and shrines and so on.

sen.j: 乱において山名宗全（持豊）率いる西軍に属した近江守護六角氏もまた、国内の荘園や将軍義尚近臣の所領を押領し、幕府への反抗の態度を露骨に表していた。
sen.e: Omi shugo (the Governor of Omi Province) the Rokkaku clan, who has belonged to the West squad led by Sozen (Mochitoyo) YAMANA in Onin-Bunmei Wars, also wrested shoen (private estates) in the country and territories of trusted vassals of the Shogun Yoshihisa, thereby explicitly showing a rebellious attitude to bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 「乱」は「応仁・文明の乱」として訳しました。
sen.e: Omi shugo (the Governor of Omi Province) the Rokkaku clan, who had belonged to the West squad led by Sozen (Mochitoyo) YAMANA in Onin-Bunmei Wars, also wrested shoen (private estates) in the province and territories of the trusted vassals of the Shogun Yoshihisa, thereby explicitly showing a rebellious attitude towards the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: has→had,to→towards,country→province （ここでの”国”とはprovince のことと理解し、修正しました）the を補いました。
sen.e: Omi shugo (the Governor of Omi Province) the Rokkaku clan, who had belonged to the West squad led by Sozen (Mochitoyo) YAMANA in Onin-Bunmei Wars, also wrested shoen (private estates) in the province and territories of the trusted vassals of the Shogun Yoshihisa, thereby explicitly showing a rebellious attitude towards the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: そこで幕府は威信回復を企図し六角氏の討伐を行った。
sen.e: Therefore, bakufu intended to recover its dignity and put down the Rokkaku clan.
Therefore, the bakufu intended to recover its dignity and subjugate the Rokkaku clan.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。put down→subjugate と修正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, the bakufu intended to recover its dignity and subjugate the Rokkaku clan.

sen.j: 鈎の陣
sen.e: Magari no Jin
Magari no Jin
Magari no Jin

sen.j: 長享元年（1487年）、9代将軍足利義尚は六角高頼征伐を決定し、将軍直属の奉公衆を中心とした軍を率いて近江坂本へ出陣、9月には管領細川政元・若狭国守護武田国信・加賀国守護富樫政親を近江に召集し、高頼を攻撃する。
sen.e: In 1487, the 9th Shogun Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA decided to put down Takayori ROKKAKU and headed an army mainly consisted of hokoshu (the shogunal military guard) directly under the Shogun to go into battle at Sakamoto in Omi Province, and in September the Shogun drafted Shogunal Deputy Masamoto HOSOKAWA, Wakasa no kuni shugo (the provincial constable of Wakasa Province) Kuninobu TAKEDA and Kaga no kuni shugo (the provincial constable of Kaga Province) Masachika TOGASHI in Omi Province and attacked Takayori.

In 1487, the ninth Shogun Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA decided to subjugate Takayori ROKKAKU, and headed an army mainly consisted of hokoshu (the shogunal military guard) directly under him to go into the battle in Sakamoto in Omi Province, and in September, the Shogun ordered the Shogunal Deputy Masamoto HOSOKAWA, Wakasa no kuni shugo (the provincial constable of Wakasa Province) Kuninobu TAKEDA and Kaga no kuni shugo (the provincial constable of Kaga Province) Masachika TOGASHI to Omi Province and attacked Takayori.
sen.cmt: 9th→ninth,put down→subjugate,the Shogun→him,at→in,drafted...in→ordered...to と修正しました。カンマ、the を補いました。
sen.e: In 1487, the ninth Shogun Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA decided to subjugate Takayori ROKKAKU, and headed an army mainly consisted of hokoshu (the shogunal military guard) directly under him to go into the battle in Sakamoto in Omi Province, and in September, the Shogun ordered the Shogunal Deputy Masamoto HOSOKAWA, Wakasa no kuni shugo (the provincial constable of Wakasa Province) Kuninobu TAKEDA and Kaga no kuni shugo (the provincial constable of Kaga Province) Masachika TOGASHI to Omi Province and attacked Takayori.

sen.j: 高頼はいったん観音寺城を放棄し、甲賀郡山間部でのゲリラ戦を展開。
sen.e: Takayori temporarily abandoned Kannonji-jo Castle and conducted a guerrilla warfare in a mountainous region in Koga gun.
Takayori temporarily abandoned Kannonji-jo Castle, and conducted a guerrilla warfare in a mountainous area in Koga County.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。region→area,gun→County と修正しました。
sen.e: Takayori temporarily abandoned Kannonji-jo Castle, and conducted a guerrilla warfare in a mountainous area in Koga County.

sen.j: 義尚自らも出陣したが、膠着状態となった。
sen.e: Yoshihisa himself also went to the front, but the war was deadlocked.
Yoshihisa himself also went to the front, but the war bemace deadlocked.
Yoshihisa himself also went to the front, but the war bemace deadlocked.

sen.j: 翌年、加賀一向一揆の激化によって幕府軍が頼みとしていた富樫政親は国許に帰還、しかも、その一揆に討たれるという事件が発生する。
sen.e: The following year, Masachika TOGASHI whom the army of bakufu depended on returned to his hometown because Kaga Ikko ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers in Kaga Province) intensified and in addition an incident occurred in which he was killed in this ikki.

The following year, Masachika TOGASHI, on whom the army of bakufu was depending returned to his hometown due to the Kaga Ikko ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers in Kaga Province) intensified, and in addition, an incident occurred in which he was killed in the ikki.
sen.cmt: on を移動しました。depended→was dependingbecause→due to,this→the と修正しました。the, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: The following year, Masachika TOGASHI, on whom the army of bakufu was depending returned to his hometown due to the Kaga Ikko ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers in Kaga Province) intensified, and in addition, an incident occurred in which he was killed in the ikki.

sen.j: 義尚は本願寺や一揆勢をも討伐する意を示すが、六角氏討伐中という事で細川政元からも反対され、断念に追い込まれる。
sen.e: Yoshihisa showed his determination to put down Hongan-ji Temple and a force of the uprising as well, but he was forced to abandon it because Masamoto HOSOKAWA disagreed with him for the reason that suppression of the Rokkaku clan was ongoing.

Yoshihisa showed his determination to subjugate Hongan-ji Temple and the forces of uprising as well, but he was forced to abandon it because Masamoto HOSOKAWA also disagreed with him for the reason that the suppression of the Rokkaku clan was ongoing.
sen.cmt: put down→subjugate,a force→the forces,the uprising→uprising と修正しました。also, the を補いました。
sen.e: Yoshihisa showed his determination to subjugate Hongan-ji Temple and the forces of uprising as well, but he was forced to abandon it because Masamoto HOSOKAWA also disagreed with him for the reason that the suppression of the Rokkaku clan was ongoing.

sen.j: 越前国守護となった朝倉貞景 (9代当主)と美濃国守護の土岐成頼は、地理的にも加賀よりも参陣しやすい条件にありながら、次の標的が自分たちに向けられる事を危惧して動かなかった。
sen.e: Sadakage ASAKURA (the 9th family head) who became Echizen no kuni shugo (the Governor of Echizen Province) and Mino no kuni shugo (the Governor of Mino Province) Shigeyori TOKI did not move for fear that they would become the next targets, although they had geographically better conditions than Kaga Province to join the camp.

Sadakage ASAKURA (the ninth family head) who became Echizen no kuni shugo (the Governor of Echizen Province) and Mino no kuni shugo (the Governor of Mino Province) Shigeyori TOKI did not move for fear that they would become the next targets, although they had geographically better conditions than Kaga Province to join the camp.

Sadakage ASAKURA (the ninth family head) who became Echizen no kuni shugo (the Governor of Echizen Province) and Mino no kuni shugo (the Governor of Mino Province) Shigeyori TOKI did not move for fear that they would become the next targets, although they had geographically better conditions than Kaga Province to join the camp.

sen.j: 朝倉貞景は自らは本国に留まりながらも、一門の朝倉景冬を近江坂本に派兵し、最低限の協調姿勢は見せた。
sen.e: Although Sadakage ASAKURA himself stayed in his hometown, he dispatched Kagefuyu ASAKURA of his family to Sakamoto in Omi Province, thereby showing his cooperative attitude at a minimum.
Although Sadakage ASAKURA himself stayed in his province, he dispatched Kagefuyu ASAKURA of his family to Sakamoto in Omi Province, thereby showing his minimally cooperative attitude.
sen.cmt: hometown→province と修正しました。at a minimum→minimally とし、移動しました。
sen.e: Although Sadakage ASAKURA himself stayed in his province, he dispatched Kagefuyu ASAKURA of his family to Sakamoto in Omi Province, thereby showing his minimally cooperative attitude.

sen.j: ところが、土岐成頼は美濃で挙兵し、しかもそのまま山中に籠って幕府軍を威圧した。
sen.e: However, Shigeyori TOKI raised an army in Mino Province and in addition he stayed in the mountains to intimidate the army of bakufu.
However, Shigeyori TOKI raised an army in Mino Province, and in addition he stayed in the mountains to intimidate the army of bakufu.
However, Shigeyori TOKI raised an army in Mino Province, and in addition he stayed in the mountains to intimidate the army of bakufu.

sen.j: 結局延徳元年（1489年）、義熙と改名していた義尚は近江鈎の陣中で死去したため、幕府による討伐は中断となり、高頼は一時赦免された。
sen.e: Finally, in 1489, Yoshihisa who has changed his name to Yoshihiro died at the front at Magari in Omi Province and therefore suppression by bakufu was suspended and Takayori was temporarily discharged.

After all, in 1489, Yoshihisa who had changed his name to Yoshihiro died at the front at Magari in Omi Province, and therefore the suppression by bakufu was suspended and Takayori was temporarily discharged.

sen.e: After all, in 1489, Yoshihisa who had changed his name to Yoshihiro died at the front at Magari in Omi Province, and therefore the suppression by bakufu was suspended and Takayori was temporarily discharged.

sen.j: 第二次六角攻め
sen.e: The second campaign against the Rokkaku clan
The second campaign against the Rokkaku clan
The second campaign against the Rokkaku clan

sen.j: 義尚の後を継いだ足利義稙も、延徳3年（1491年）に再び高頼討伐を行った。
sen.e: Yoshitane ASHIKAGA who succeeded to Yoshihisa also put down Takayori again in 1491.
Yoshitane ASHIKAGA who succeeded to Yoshihisa also started to suppress Takayori again in 1491.

sen.e: Yoshitane ASHIKAGA who succeeded to Yoshihisa also started to suppress Takayori again in 1491.

sen.j: 高頼が甲賀郡から伊勢国へ逃れたため、幕府軍は討伐を断念。
sen.e: The army of bakufu abandoned suppression because Takayori escaped from Koga gun to Ise Province.
The army of bakufu abandoned the suppression because Takayori escaped from Koga County to Ise Province.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。gun→County と修正しました。
sen.e: The army of bakufu abandoned the suppression because Takayori escaped from Koga County to Ise Province.

sen.j: 近江国から撤退した。
sen.e: The army of bakufu withdrew from Omi Province.
The army of bakufu withdrew from Omi Province.
The army of bakufu withdrew from Omi Province.

sen.j: 2度の討伐失敗、翌明応2年（1493年）に細川政元が将軍・義材を廃した明応の政変により、幕府の権威は大きく失墜。
sen.e: Due to failure in two campaigns for suppression and Meio Coup in 1493 where Masamoto HOSOKAWA forced the Shogun Yoshiki to abdicate, the authority of bakufu significantly reduced.
Due to the failure in two campaigns for the suppression, and the Meio Coup in 1493 where Masamoto HOSOKAWA forced the Shogun Yoshiki to abdicate, the authority of the bakufu significantly reduced.

sen.e: Due to the failure in two campaigns for the suppression, and the Meio Coup in 1493 where Masamoto HOSOKAWA forced the Shogun Yoshiki to abdicate, the authority of the bakufu significantly reduced.

sen.j: 首を挿げ替えられた前将軍義材は復権活動に終始する。
sen.e: The former Shogun Yoshiki who was forced to abdicate was preoccupied with the activity for reinstatement.
The former Shogun Yoshiki, who was rehabilitated, was preoccupied with the activity for reinstatement.
sen.cmt: forced to→rehabilitated と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: The former Shogun Yoshiki, who was rehabilitated, was preoccupied with the activity for reinstatement.

sen.j: 以後の畿内は、将軍職争いに端を発した戦乱（船岡山合戦など）に巻き込まれる。
sen.e: Afterwards, Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) got involved in wars (such as Funaokayama-gassen (battle of Mt. Funaoka)) originating from a struggle for the shogunate.

Afterwards, the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) came to be involved in wars (such as Funaokayama-gassen [battle of Mt. Funaoka]) originating from a struggle over the position of shogunate.
